metadata.title: CVE-2023-23597 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: A compromised web child process could disable web security openingrestrictions, leading to a new child process being spawned within thefile:// context. Given a reliable exploit primitive, this newprocess could be exploited again leading to arbitrary file read. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 109. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23597` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
